business.headline: Hiding income or making wrong claims? Your ITR could attract a 200% penaltyThe recent changes in Income Tax Return (ITR) regulations highlight stricter penalties for incorrect filings, including a potential 200% penalty on false claims.

The disappearing dream of affordable housingAffordable housing is vanishing from India's cities, and the crisis runs deeper than shrinking supply. In this deep dive, we explore how rising costs, fading supply, and policy gaps are shutting the door on millions chasing the ownership dream.

How expensive a house should you buy? Investment banker shares these 6 rulesAn investment banker lays down six clear, conservative rules for home buying to help first-time buyers avoid the trap of overleveraged homeownership.

Received Form 16? Don't file your ITR without checking these pointsForm 16 is a certificate your employer gives you every year. It shows how much salary you earned in the financial year and how much tax was deducted from it. This tax is called TDS (Tax Deducted at Source).

Nvidia overtakes Microsoft as world's most valuable company after 4% surgeNvidia's shares touched a new record high of $154.10, after climbing 4.33% during the trading session. This rally followed a positive report from Loop Capital, which raised its price target for Nvidia from $175 to $250.

Sensex rises over 500 points, crosses 83,000: Why is stock market rising today?By 9:59 am, the Sensex had gained 549 points to touch 83,305.06, while the Nifty rose by 172.75 points to 25,417.50. The mood across the broader market was upbeat, and volatility remained surprisingly muted.

US Bitcoin Reserve signals a shift: An opening for IndiaIndia stands at a pivotal juncture. A measured Bitcoin strategy—perhaps a reserve pilot—could strengthen economic resilience and project modernity. As the US advances and nations like Bhutan adapt, India has a unique opportunity to lead.
Sensex opens 127 points higher, Nifty above 25,200; Eternal gains 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 364.24 points to 83,119.75, while the NSE Nifty50 added 114.95 points to 25,359.70 as of 9:31 am.

Sebi penalises BSE Rs 25 lakh for unequal data access, failure in oversightSebi called the failure by BSE 'laxity and negligence' and pointed out that BSE, being a first-level regulator, has a duty to maintain a clean and fair trading environment.

Sensex, Nifty opening on June 26: Will stock market rise again today?As of 8:24 am, the Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,287 points. This suggests that the Nifty50 could open around its previous close of 25,244.75.

Stocks to watch on June 26: SBI, Tata Steel, One Mobikwik, Adani EnterprisesStrong global signals and a steady flow of news from domestic companies helped keep investor sentiment upbeat as Sensex and Nifty gained nearly 1% in the last session.
Adani Total Gas and Jio-bp partner to expand fuel access across IndiaThis collaboration will see Jio-bp's premium petrol and diesel sold at select Adani fuel outlets, according to ATGL's statement.

entertainment.headline: Actor Fatima Sana Shaikh breaks silence on dating rumours with Vijay VarmaActor Fatima Sana Shaikh said she's single and there is no one in her life as good guys exist only in films. Her statement came after dating rumours between her and actor Vijay Varma surfaced online.

F1 X reviews: Brad Pitt's film is worth a trip to cinemas, fans call it outstandingJoseph Kosinski's 'F1' starring Brad Pitt has thrilled audiences worldwide with its high-octane action and immersive IMAX experience. The film promises adrenaline-pumping scenes and a cinematic treat for motorsport fans in India.

3BHK trailer: Siddharth powers through emotional middle-class tale of buying a houseDirected by Sri Ganesh, '3BHK' is an emotional tale about a middle-class family of four and their wish to own a house in the city. The film stars Siddharth, Sarathkumar, Devayani and Meetha Raghunath in lead roles.

War 2: Hrithik, Jr NTR and Kiara Advani's 1st look posters promise power and actionOn Thursday, the makers of 'War 2' unveiled the first-look posters of Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR and Kiara Advani, showcasing them in fierce and commanding avatars. The film is set to hit theatres on August 14.

Diljit Dosanjh reacts to criticism of speaking only about Punjab, not IndiaDiljit Dosanjh got emotional while recalling how he represented Punjab at global events like the Met Gala, saying it was never about him but about showcasing his culture. He also addressed criticism for not speaking about India, stating, "I am Punjabi, what can I say?"

Fantastic Four final trailer: Marvel's first family faces Galactus in epic showdownThe final trailer of 'Fantastic Four: The First Steps' shows the epic battle between Marvel's first superhero family and their arch-rival Galactus. The film will release in theatres on July 25, 2025

Kuberaa box office Day 6: Dhanush-Nagarjuna's film is Rs 100 crore strongDirector Sekhar Kammula's 'Kuberaa' starring Dhanush and Nagarjuna earned Rs 100 crore globally in its first week in theatres. The film is now eyeing a solid second weekend in cinemas.

Unbroken Rashmika Mandanna debuts her wounded warrior look in new filmActor Rashmika Mandanna announced her new film on social media on Thursday. The title of the film and more details about it will be out on Friday at 10:08 am.

New missions to come: Dune director Denis Villeneuve on helming new James Bond filmDirector Denis Villeneuve will be helming the next James Bond film. He emphasised honouring the legacy and introducing many new missions to the franchise.

Sitaare Zameen Par box office Day 6: Aamir Khan's film steady during weekdaysAamir Khan's 'Sitaare Zameen Par' is working well during the weekdays at the box office. The film has surpassed the Rs 80 crore benchmark and is now looking at going past Rs 100 crore by the end of its second weekend.

Did Ankita Lokhande confirm pregnancy in new LaughterChefs 2 promo? WatchAnkita Lokhande recently appeared to have confirmed her pregnancy in a new 'LaughterChefs 2' promo video. The revealtion left many fans congratulating the actor.

Amitabh Bachchan spent entire night re-dubbing for Agneepath: Abhishek BachchanAbhishek Bachchan, in an exclusive interview with India Today, shared a rare insight about Amitabh Bachchan re-dubbing the entire 'Agneepath' film in one night. The legendary actor changed his voice for the movie, which initially upset audiences.

Vishnu Manchu's Kannappa ticket price hiked by Rs 50 in Andhra PradeshActor Vishnu Manchu's 'Kannappa' is set to release on June 27. Ahead of its premiere, the Andhra Pradesh government has approved a Rs 50 hike in the standard ticket price across the state.

AR Rahman, J-Hope collab calls trend after BTS star vibes to Yaara at fashion showOscar-winning composer AR Rahman teamed up with Pharrell Williams for a Punjabi track Yaara, which premiered at Paris Fashion Week. The song has gained widespread social media acclaim, with BTS's J-Hope spotted enjoying the music live.

Diljit must apologise, remove objectionable scenes: Mika Singh amid Sardaar Ji 3 rowSinger-rapper Mika Singh, in another post, said that he is willing to forgive Diljit Dosanjh if he apologises. He called him a 'fake' singer and lashed out at him for working with a Pakistani actor in 'Sardaar Ji 3'.

Netflix drops season 2 of The Ultimatum: Queer Love, set in MiamiNetflix's The Ultimatum: Queer Love returns for Season 2 in vibrant Miami, exploring love and commitment among six queer couples in a bold relationship test.
Fitness influencer 'Liver King' arrested after threatening Joe Rogan onlineFitness influencer Liver King Brian Johnson was arrested in Austin for threatening Joe Rogan on social media.

Perfect Match season 3: Netflix announces cast and release schedulePerfect Match Season 3 premieres August 1 on Netflix, featuring stars from The Bachelor, Love Island, and more in a high-stakes dating showdown.

Film body slams Diljit Dosanjh's casting in Border 2 amid Sardaar Ji 3 rowThe Federation of Western India Cine Employees (FWICE) has condemned Diljit Dosanjh's casting in 'Border 2'. This move highlights ongoing tensions over collaborations with Pakistani artistes and national sentiment.

general news.headline: Like baby learning to walk: Shubhanshu Shukla describes his space debut in call Live UpdatesIn his first call from space, Shubhanshu Shukla said that this mission was 'a strong step forward for India's human space program and for the upcoming Gaganyaan mission.'

Rajnath Singh refuses to sign SCO document as Pak-China snub PahalgamChina and its 'all-weather friend' Pakistan tried to divert the attention from terrorism in the SCO document, but Rajnath Singh firmly stood his ground on India's stand on terrorism.

Constitution or Parliament, which is supreme? Chief Justice answers amid debateJustice Gavai, speaking at a felicitation event in his hometown, said all three wings of democracy - the executive, legislature and the judiciary - work under the Constitution.

100% lunatic: Trump rages after Zohran Mamdani wins New York mayoral primaryDonald Trump launched a furious attack on Zohran Mamdani after the 33-year-old Democratic socialist won NYC's mayoral primary. Calling him a "100% Communist Lunatic," he also mocked Mamdani's appearance and allies, while warning that Democrats are pushing the country toward extreme left politics.

How India's Op Sindoor and Israel's Op Rising Lion were similar | 5 pointsFrom the idea of safeguarding the country and its people with aerial strikes inside enemy territory to a nuclear quotient, Israel's Operation Rising Lion had several similarities with India's Operation Sindoor. Trump's truce claims and ceasefire breaches in both cases were also uncannily similar.

20-year-old woman dies after falling from 13th floor while filming reel in BengaluruA 20-year-old woman died after falling from the 13th floor of an under-construction building in Bengaluru's Parappana Agrahara while filming a reel. She was partying with friends when the incident happened.

Where is Khamenei? Supreme Leader absent while Iran faces deadliest escalationAmid the deadliest escalation between Iran and Israel in decades, Supreme Leader Ayatollah Khamenei's week-long absence from public view has triggered anxiety in the Islamic nation.

Diljit Dosanjh reacts to criticism of speaking only about Punjab, not IndiaDiljit Dosanjh got emotional while recalling how he represented Punjab at global events like the Met Gala, saying it was never about him but about showcasing his culture. He also addressed criticism for not speaking about India, stating, "I am Punjabi, what can I say?"

Shubhanshu Shukla's space buddy Joy the astroswan has a proud Indian linkIn a tradition dating back to the earliest human spaceflights, a plush toy is released inside the spacecraft to signal the moment of true weightlessness.
Meril Launches MyClip, India's First Transcatheter-Edge-to-Edge Repair (TEER) SystemThe launch of MyClip TEER System marks a transformative moment for structural heart therapy in India.

Muslim woman's right to seek divorce absolute, husband's consent not needed: CourtIn its ruling, the High Court affirmed that a Muslim woman can unilaterally seek Khula, a divorce initiated by the wife, without her husband's consent or the involvement of religious bodies.
Traders on Kanwar Yatra route must display their names on shop: Yogi AdityanathYogi Adityanath instructed officials to ensure that no open sale of meat takes place along the yatra route.

Air travel will get super-cheap. A 35-minute flight just proved thatElectric air travel has officially arrived. The Alia CX300 aircraft flew 130 km from East Hampton to New York's JFK in just half an hour. The one-way, 35-minute trip, which cost passengers only $8 (around Rs 700), heralds a new era of cheap air travel.

'Silver dinner plates, Rs 5,000 per meal': Maharashtra government event sparks rowAn event hosted by the Maharashtra government has come under the scanner after guests were served meals on silver plates, despite the state facing strain. However, sources refuted claims of the government hosting a "lavish" party.

Transition no excuse, India needs to take World Test Championship seriouslyEngland vs India: India are a team in transition, and the Headingley Test can be seen as a minor blip in their journey as a side. However, transition cannot be used as an excuse for the poor display at vital moments in a game that India could have easily won.

Watch Shubhanshu Shukla's first radio call from space Ft. Joy the 'astro-swan'Indian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla made his first call from space, describing Wednesday's launch as "indescribable." Beginning with a cheerful "namaskar" from orbit, Shukla shared that he is slowly adjusting to life in zero gravity.

Prada ignored India. Louis Vuitton put it centre stage at Paris Fashion Week French luxury brand LV's creative director and rapper Pharrell Williams put on a show that openly celebrated India, a move that LV's contemporaries (hello, Prada) should certainly take cues from.

Trump, Iran, and 'daddy' drama: Nato summit gets weirdNATO Secretary General Mark Rutte clarified he didn't call Donald Trump "daddy," saying he used the term to explain how countries ask if the US will stay committed to NATO. Rutte praised Trump for his decisive strike on Iran's nuclear sites.

Shubhanshu Shukla launched: Ex-Isro scientist explains space dockingThe Dragon's docking with the ISS is a sophisticated procedure that typically occurs 12–24 hours after launch, involving autonomous systems with human monitoring.

Case against BJP Karnataka for calling Indira Gandhi 'Hitler' in social media postAn FIR was filed against BJP Karnataka at High Grounds police station after its social media post compared former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi to Hitler. The complaint came from KPCC General Secretary S Manohar, citing defamation.

What it takes to make love last after 60In between building a life and raising a family, do couples lose the script of how to grow old together? Experts say it is normal. It is not about chasing sparks but keeping the warmth alive.

Navy staffer arrested for spying for Pakistan, leaked critical info on Op SindoorThe accused was in regular contact with a Pakistani female handler, who allegedly lured him with money in exchange for critical strategic information from naval operations, on social media.

Can see it's upsetting: Trump responds to Ukraine reporter's emotional questionA Ukrainian journalist's emotional question to Donald Trump on US air defence support drew a rare moment of empathy at the Nato summit, as her husband fights on Ukraine's frontlines.

Bid to deflect attention: India calls out Pak's 'nefarious agenda' at UN meetIndian Ambassador called out Pakistan's efforts to shift focus were aimed at distracting from its own record of atrocities against children.

sports.headline: Rohit reveals India wanted November 19 revenge on Australia in T20 World CupRohit Sharma revealed that the Indian team wanted to take revenge on Australia during the T20 World Cup 2024 after they were beaten by the Aussies in the final of the ODI World Cup 2023 in Ahmedabad on November 19.

Why was Bumrah's participation not kept a secret? Aakash Chopra questions callAakash Chopra questioned why the Indian team management made Jasprit Bumrah's participation in the England series public. Bumrah is expected to play just three Tests against England.

Suryakumar Yadav undergoes successful sports hernia surgery in GermanyIndia's T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav has undergone successful surgery for a sports hernia in his lower right abdomen, performed in Munich, Germany. He is expected to begin rehabilitation soon and lead India in upcoming T20I matches.

Who could join Carlos Alcaraz, Jannik Sinner in new Big Three? John McEnroe revealsAmerican tennis legend John McEnroe has called for the emergence of a third standout player to join Carlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner in forming a new Big Three. He believes that a strong third contender would raise the level of competition and named three rising stars as potential candidates.

Chhattisgarh Muaythai athletes Bhavjot and Shubham win bronze in AsiaYoung Muaythai talents from Chhattisgarh, Bhavjot Singh Kohli and Shubham Kumar Nishad, have made the state proud by winning bronze medals for India at the Senior Asian Muaythai Championship held in Vietnam.

How Ben Duckett and Ollie Pope neutralised Jasprit Bumrah in 1st TestEngland vs India, 1st Test: Ben Duckett played a fantastic innings in Leeds to hand England a 1-0 lead in the 5-match Test series. Duckett's handling of Bumrah might turn out to be crucial in this Test series.

AB de Villiers gives honest verdict on Rishabh Pant's batting mindsetAB de Villiers shared his honest take on Rishabh Pant's fearless batting in the first Test against England at Leeds. Pant scored 134 and 118 in a losing cause, but his aggressive approach and twin tons helped him break a few batting records.

Club World Cup: Inter, Monterrey through to Round of 16, BVB winInter, Monterrey and Borussia Dortmund have secured their spots in the Round of 16 stages of the FIFA Club World Cup after their respective wins in the final group-stage watch.

Shubman Gill will only get better as Test captain: Chappell backs India skipperGreg Chappell has thrown his support behind Shubman Gill, saying the young opener showed encouraging signs in his first outing as India's Test captain. Despite the five-wicket defeat to England in Leeds, Chappell believes Gill has the temperament to evolve into a strong leader in the longest format.

Michael Vaughan taunts Wasim Jaffer, predicts 4-0 England sweepFormer England captain Michael Vaughan, known for his spirited banter with former Indian opener Wasim Jaffer on X (formerly Twitter), didn't miss the chance to take a dig after India's five-wicket defeat in the first Test at Headingley. Seizing the moment, Vaughan not only poked fun at Jaffer but also revised his series prediction, calling for a 4-0 win in England's favour.

AB de Villiers gives honest verdict on Rishabh Pant's batting mindsetAB de Villiers shared his honest take on Rishabh Pant's fearless batting in the first Test against England at Leeds. Pant scored 134 and 118 in a losing cause, but his aggressive approach and twin tons helped him break a few batting records.

Club World Cup: Inter, Monterrey through to Round of 16, BVB winInter, Monterrey and Borussia Dortmund have secured their spots in the Round of 16 stages of the FIFA Club World Cup after their respective wins in the final group-stage watch.

Shubman Gill will only get better as Test captain: Chappell backs India skipperGreg Chappell has thrown his support behind Shubman Gill, saying the young opener showed encouraging signs in his first outing as India's Test captain. Despite the five-wicket defeat to England in Leeds, Chappell believes Gill has the temperament to evolve into a strong leader in the longest format.

Michael Vaughan taunts Wasim Jaffer, predicts 4-0 England sweepFormer England captain Michael Vaughan, known for his spirited banter with former Indian opener Wasim Jaffer on X (formerly Twitter), didn't miss the chance to take a dig after India's five-wicket defeat in the first Test at Headingley. Seizing the moment, Vaughan not only poked fun at Jaffer but also revised his series prediction, calling for a 4-0 win in England's favour.

Transition no excuse, India needs to take World Test Championship seriouslyEngland vs India: India are a team in transition, and the Headingley Test can be seen as a minor blip in their journey as a side. However, transition cannot be used as an excuse for the poor display at vital moments in a game that India could have easily won.

Seales, Shamar shine against Australia on 14-wicket opening dayJayden Seales and Shamar Joseph evoked memories of West Indies' legendary pace attacks, dismantling Australia for just 180 on a lively Kensington Oval pitch on day one of the first Test. Australia hit back through Mitchell Starc, Pat Cummins, and Josh Hazlewood, who shared four wickets to leave West Indies struggling at 57 for four at stumps.

Gill lacked authority in Leeds, claims former spinner: Had too many captainsFormer India spinner-turned commentator Murali Kartik feels Shubman Gill lacked authority as a leader during the first Test against England at Headingley, Leeds.

Rishabh Pant is reinventing batsmanship, reminds of Gilchrist: Greg ChappellFormer Australia cricketer Greg Chappell has showered praise on India's wicketkeeper batter Rishabh Pant, saying that he's reinventing the game.

Rishabh Pant was the only one who contacted me during tough times: Prithvi ShawIndia and Mumbai batter Prithvi Shaw revealed that he only received support from Rishabh Pant during the tough phase of his career. Shaw has been going through tumultuous times in his professional life as he found no bidders during the IPL 2025 auction.

IPL: Rajasthan Royals owner accuses former co-owner of blackmail in UK courtLondon-based venture capitalist Manoj Badale and his company Emerging Media Ventures are suing businessman Raj Kundra at London's High Court for allegedly breaching a 2019 confidential settlement agreement.

Sam Konstas fails on return as Shamar Joseph decimates top orderWI vs AUS, 1st Test: Australia's returning opener Sam Konstas and new No. 3 Cameron Green failed in the first hour on Day 1. Pacers Shamar Joseph and Jayden Seales made the most of helpful conditions on Wednesday morning in Barbados.

Sri Lanka dominate proceedings as Bangladesh collapse on Day 1 in ColomboSri Lanka had a dominating Day 1 of the second Test against Bangladesh in Colombo as they left them reeling at 220/8 at the stumps. Asitha Fernando (2/43), Vishwa Fernando (2/35) and Sonal Dinusha (2/22) emerged as top performers from the day.

Rishabh Pant was the only one who contacted me during tough times: Prithvi ShawIndia and Mumbai batter Prithvi Shaw revealed that he only received support from Rishabh Pant during the tough phase of his career. Shaw has been going through tumultuous times in his professional life as he found no bidders during the IPL 2025 auction.

IPL: Rajasthan Royals owner accuses former co-owner of blackmail in UK courtLondon-based venture capitalist Manoj Badale and his company Emerging Media Ventures are suing businessman Raj Kundra at London's High Court for allegedly breaching a 2019 confidential settlement agreement.

Sam Konstas fails on return as Shamar Joseph decimates top orderWI vs AUS, 1st Test: Australia's returning opener Sam Konstas and new No. 3 Cameron Green failed in the first hour on Day 1. Pacers Shamar Joseph and Jayden Seales made the most of helpful conditions on Wednesday morning in Barbados.

Sri Lanka dominate proceedings as Bangladesh collapse on Day 1 in ColomboSri Lanka had a dominating Day 1 of the second Test against Bangladesh in Colombo as they left them reeling at 220/8 at the stumps. Asitha Fernando (2/43), Vishwa Fernando (2/35) and Sonal Dinusha (2/22) emerged as top performers from the day.

Harshit Rana released from Test squad, day after Gambhir's clarification: ReportFast bowler Harshit Rana has been released from India's Test squad before the second Test in Birmingham. He did not travel with the rest of the team, which left for Birmingham from Leeds on Wednesday, June 25.

How Ravi Shastri's booming voice made Rohit forget toss coin, batter revealsIndia ODI captain Rohit Sharma recently revealed how Ravi Shastri made him forget the coin toss during the blockbuster clash against Pakistan in the T20 World Cup 2024.

I was panicking: Rohit on how Virat calmed dressing room in T20 World Cup finalRohit Sharma reflected on the dramatic turn of events in the T20 World Cup 2024 final, heaping praise on the match-winning knocks of Virat Kohli and Axar Patel. He described the triumph in Barbados as the greatest moment of his career.

Shardul Thakur in Leeds Test: Misfiring or mismanaged? Numbers say it allIndia all-rounder Shardul Thakur was underutilised by captain Shubman Gill in the first innings despite Prasidh Krishna and Mohammed Siraj leaking runs consistently. The India captain did realise his mistake and made the India seamer deliver ten overs in the second innings, where he helped scalp two wickets.

Shubman Gill has everything to be a successful captain: Gautam GambhirGautam Gambhir feels that Shubman Gill has all the skills to be a successful captain for India, but said that the 25-year-old needs to be given the time to excel. Gill's first outing as captain ended in a loss for India at Headingley.

Ben Duckett is England's answer to Virender Sehwag: David Lloyd praises openerAfter his heroics in the Headingley Test, former England cricketer David Lloyd compared Ben Duckett to Virender Sehwag. Duckett was the star of the show as England won the match by five wickets.

Shubman Gill captained better than Ben Stokes during Leeds Test: Mohammad KaifFormer India cricketer turned commentator Mohammad Kaif has praised India's new Test captain Shubman Gill, saying that he captained better than Ben Stokes in the first Test against England at Headigley, Leeds.

Doubt Jasprit Bumrah would want to play at Edgbaston: Dinesh KarthikDinesh Karthik feels that Jasprit Bumrah may choose not to play the Edgbaston Test against England, especially if it turns out to be a flat track. The second Test between India and England will start on July 2.

Gambhir faces flak for response to Rishabh Pant's twin centuries in Leeds TestIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir faced flak for his response to a question regarding Rishabh Pant in the post-match press conference after India's loss to England in the first test at Headingley, Leeds.

Nine-year-old Delhi boy comes close to beating chess great Magnus CarlsenNine-year-old Aarit Kapil from Delhi nearly defeated reigning world champion Magnus Carlsen in an intense online chess match. The Indian wunderkind became the youngest from the country to defeat a Grandmaster last year.

ICC Rankings: Jadeja drops out of top 10 bowlers list after Leeds performanceRavindra Jadeja has dropped out of the top 10 bowlers list after his lacklustre performance in the Leeds Test. Jadeja struggled to create an impact in the first Test loss to England at Headingley.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
